135331.content:
Maybe that wasn't the best idea...

Tsukune reflected on his actions as he ran desperately through the undead forest of yokai academy. Today was family day at the school, a bizarre event the school holds every year where the parents of students come to watch their children and their peers at work. It's like take-your-kid-to-work day in America, except in reverse and only yokai do it. This year, the Headmaster decided to change the rules so siblings could come and watch as well. This lead to something Tsukune was very, VERY unprepared for.

Unlike previous years, Moka and Kokoa's family decided to come. As a result, Tsukune had the great honor of meeting the whole of the Shuzen clan, including the father, both wives, and the two older daughters. This meeting went well, all things considered. He made a good first impression, managed to not get pounced by the other girls while in their view, demonstrated in class that he wasn't an idiot, got into a fight with another student which lead to Moka being unsealed and her family finding out he's human which they took surprisingly well with the exception of Kokoa's mother and the eldest daughter, and managed to win them over too while at lunch by getting into another fight over a third year trying to get into Kokoa's pants and Tsukune fending him off on his own. After that, the rest of the day went smoothly with no major events until class was let out for the day.

At that point, he made his first and only mistake of the day. He tripped over the root of a tree. The resulting impact with the ground caused no damage save for a small scratch on his left palm that was just barely deep enough to let a tiny amount of blood through. The Shuzen family didn't seem to mind him tripping.

Now, all of this might have you wondering what any of this has to do with why Tsukune is running for his life through the woods. Well, a minor scratch is no big deal what so ever in any situation except for one: your hanging out with a family of seven vampires and your name is Tsukune Aono.

The smallest amount of his blood being outside of his body was more than enough to have Moka and Kokoa mesmerized and to make them instantly hungry. As it turns out, this applies to their sisters as well. When all four asked to drink some of his blood at the same time, he politely declined. You see, he let Moka and Kokoa feed on him at the same time just the day before, and it turned out he couldn't handle that much blood loss at once. He was still lightheaded from it and would need a few more days before he could let any of them feed off of him again. He, of course, explained all of this to them and even offered to let them have some at a later time if they were still interested. This placated Akua, Kahlua, and Kokoa...

but not Moka. Not when she had been unsealed most of the day. Not when she was with her family. Not when Tsukune had never, EVER declined her request for blood before. She was unreasonably angry about it and promptly kicked Tsukune in the chin, subsequently sending him flying into the woods. When he landed, he could tell by the colossal amount of dark aura baring down on him that Moka was far from done punishing him for having the audacity to tell her no. Luckily, Tsukune let his body go limp before landing, allowing the human body to do its thing and absorb the impact evenly resulting in nothing more than light bruising and was still more than capable to start running for his life, leading us to the present.

While the idea is fresh in your mind, lets take a quick look at the human body. The human body is a survival machine. It can endure ridiculous amounts of punishment and continue to function. It's extraordinarily strong too, almost comparable to a vampire, but only in certain life threatening situations. It's also quite efficient and stigmatic when it comes to running. This is because, in the early days of humanity, we evolved to be quite good at persistence hunting where we would chase our prey until their body ran out of stamina, gave up, and died. As a result, a human in decent physical condition is quite adept at running, being able to run a marathon and then some with little to no ill effects. Due to his environment and a rigorous gym teacher, Tsukune happened to be in remarkably good physical condition. As a result, the run he was on right now was no major issue to his body. In fact, he could technically last longer than his pursuer in a run. The only problem is that despite how incredibly adept the human body is at running, it can still only get to a max speed of around seventeen miles per hour. What's the maximum speed of a vampire, you might ask? Well, it has never been officially measured but it's sure as hell faster than seventeen miles per hour.

As Tsukune continue to run, he could feel the dark aura get thicker and thicker around him. Knowing that aura gets thicker, more noticeable, and more powerful the closer to the source you are, Tsukune correctly deduced that Moka was catching up to him. As it grew even thicker and more oppressive, he began to hear the sound of heavy breathing from behind him. Not a moment later, he felt a sharp knock to his head, resulting in him falling into a weird looking bush. Said bush had thorns.

That was very not fun.

As Tsukune was trying to pick himself up, he got some unexpected and somewhat unwelcome help from a silver haired vampire who just spent the better part of twenty minutes angrily and hungrily chasing him through the woods. She picked him up by the back of his collar, turned him around, gave him a hangry look, and promptly bit down on the left side of his neck. The resulting blood loss caused him to loose consciousness for a while. When he woke up, he found himself....
